The standard infantry bolt-action rifle of the Imperial Japanese Army from 1905 to the end of World War II. Despite having a rough introduction, the Arisaka has been vastly improved over the years and has proven to be incredibly accurate and reliable even in adverse conditions. These days, it is a long-sought after relic of the past.
